The Best Low Carb Gluten Free Stuffing Ever!

  • 6 cups bread cubes (made with KetoFoccacia)
  • 1.5 cups chicken stock or turkey stock
  • 1 tsp fresh rosemary
  • 1 tsp poultry seasoning
  • 1 tbsp garlic powder
  • 1 medium onion
  • 3 stalks celery
  • 3 tbsp butter or olive oil
  • Salt and pepper

Preheat oven to 375

On a quarter sheet pan, add bread cubes in an even layer. If some overlap, it’s ok, but make sure the entire bottom of the pan is covered. Bake for about 30 minutes, removing to toss about 15 minutes in. Remove and let cool slightly.

While bread cubes are baking, heat butter or oil in a 12 inch non stick skillet over medium heat, adding chopped onion and celery. Cook until crisp tender, about 2 minutes. Add dry seasoning and salt and pepper, allowing the flavor to bloom for about 30 seconds. Add all stock and simmer for about 3 minutes. Toss toasted bread cubes in and lower heat to simmer, stirring to combine. Cover and allow cubes to absorb liquid – 5 minutes. Fluff with fork and serve.

You guys. I don’t know what to say about this one. It’s other level… I’m not kidding.

 

I knew that I was going to have to be diligent in getting prepared for the upcoming holidays. I think I’ve got my mashed potatoes subbed, and I won’t die without them. But I would have absolutely, 100% been dead without stuffing. It’s STUFFING!! Maybe not dead. But maybe! So why risk it.

So in my bread journey, my recent foccacia creation led me to this recipe here. As soon as I tasted it, I knew it was gonna be everything I needed for the perfect crouton.

The key here is letting your fresh bread sit out to dry overnight. For mine, that meant baking the day before, cooling my oven and leaving the pan in overnight, exposed to the air. You could leave it as little as 8 hours, but as long as 24. The longer it’s left to air, the shorter your bake time, and quicker to your pie hole! So I go the full 24 hours… because, again, stuffing.

The overall flavors I chose here are very traditional, but feel free to zest it up a little more! Maybe you like carrots? Add em. Just cook them with your celery and onion. Fresh sage? Heck yes! Just start small and taste along the way, season to your little hearts content. I loooooove stuffing with cooked sausage crumbles and dried cranberries… mmmmhmmmm. Give that a go. You won’t regret it.

I don’t really know what else to say, guys. This recipe might be my peak as a chef. But, I’ll keep trying to outdo myself… because I love to suffer. Like a true chef.
